attributes.title: How Domino's Pizza Is Made
attributes.description:
Created on April 25, 2011 by bf701 on Sourcemap.org:

Reference: Domino's Behind the Pizza website

attributes.name: How Domino's Pizza Is Made
attributes.title: How Domino's Pizza Is Made
attributes.description: Reference: Domino's Behind the Pizza website

attributes.name: Mozzarella
attributes.title: Mozzarella
attributes.description:
Best guess according to 
http://more.dominos.com/behindthepizza/#/mozzarella/step3

Leprino has a plants in several US states with the closest to Brooklyn being in Waverly, NY:
http://www.leprinofoods.com/Locations.cfm?Area=UnitedStates

Although Domino's says most of the cows supplying the milk are in California:
http://more.dominos.com/behindthepizza/#/mozzarella/step1

attributes.name: Supply Chain Center
attributes.title: Supply Chain Center
attributes.description:
All ingredients come through a supply chain center. The closest to Brooklyn is in Connecticut:
http://www.dominosbiz.com/Biz-Public-EN/Site+Content/Secondary/Careers/Distribution/Locations-DC.html

attributes.name: Natural Gas
attributes.title: Natural Gas
attributes.description: "Turning on the stove is just the start of a complicated journey over hundreds of miles, beginning in the gas fields of Texas, Louisiana, the Gulf of Mexico, and today 30%of Con Edison’s gas comes from Canada." http://www.coned.com/newsroom/energysystems_gas.asp
